summary: This document contains email correspondence primarily discussing the implications of a Sunday Times article regarding the sale of RBS Sempra and the impact of President Obama's banking reforms. Jes Staley communicates with Blythe Masters and Mike Cavanagh about the article's content and its alignment with their strategic interests.

persons.name: Jes Staley
persons.context: Jes Staley is involved in discussions regarding the implications of a news article on banking reforms and the sale of RBS Sempra.

persons.name: Blythe Masters
persons.context: Blythe Masters is part of the email chain discussing the Sunday Times article and its implications for their business strategy.

persons.name: Mike Cavanagh
persons.context: Mike Cavanagh is included in the email correspondence regarding the article and the sale of RBS Sempra.

persons.name: Kristin C Lemkau
persons.context: Kristin C Lemkau is copied on the email chain discussing the implications of the Sunday Times article.

persons.name: David M Wells
persons.context: David M Wells sends an email regarding the Sunday Times article and its failure to reflect their guidance.

connections.description: Jes Staley and Blythe Masters are communicating about business strategies related to the banking sector.
Blythe Masters and Mike Cavanagh are part of the same email thread discussing the implications of a news article.
David M Wells communicates with Blythe Masters regarding the Sunday Times article and its content.

events.title: Discussion on RBS Sempra Sale
events.description: Email correspondence discussing the implications of the Sunday Times article on the sale of RBS Sempra and the impact of President Obama's banking reforms.

keyFacts: The email discusses the implications of President Obama's banking reforms on the sale of RBS Sempra.
Jes Staley expresses that the article does not suggest they are opposing the President.
David M Wells notes that the Sunday Times article does not reflect their guidance.
JP Morgan is mentioned as an exclusive bidder for RBS Sempra just before the announcement of the banking reforms.
The document contains multiple email exchanges among key figures in the financial sector.
